chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin S. Copus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: any other sentences.
EMP, ATIP or any other electronic monitoring approved, per jail rules.  DNA sample ordered.

juff
Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.  Proceed to plea/sentencing today.

Defendant Dustin S. Copus in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Dustin S. Copus in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton advises matter is resolved.  Plea to amended Count 1 of 948.10, a felony.    Court goes through waiver of preliminary hearing orally with defendant.  Probable cause found.  Information filed by the State with amended count brought forward.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Victim statement reviewed.  Attorney Middleton makes final statement.  Request transfer to Dane County, delayed start and EMP, per jail rules.  State request DNA sample be ordered.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1 as amended:
$268.00 costs and $250.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
12 months in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Transfer to Dane County Jail and EMP, ATIP or any other electronic monitoring, per jail rules.  Commence on or before Sept 25, 2015 at 6:30 p.m.  
DNA sample ordered.
Paperwork handed in court.
Dane Co. jail
